com.appboy
Class AppboyUser

java.lang.Object
  com.appboy.AppboyUser

public class AppboyUser
extends java.lang.Object

AppboyUser provides an object which lets you update the attributes stored by Appboy for your user. This class has been designed to provide fire and forget semantics and to not impact the performance or lifecycle of calling code. As such, in the case of any Exception, all class methods catch and log the error, and then return false. Some methods also enforce input validation, the rules of which are documented on the individual method. Changes made to an AppboyUser are persisted using SharedPreferences storage until they are persisted to Appboy's servers. In all supported Android versions except Froyo, writing to SharedPreferences is performed asynchronously.

setIsSubscribedToEmails

public boolean setIsSubscribedToEmails(boolean isSubscribedToEmails)
Sets whether or not the user should be sent email campaigns. Setting it to false opts the user out of an email campaign that you create through the Appboy dashboard.

Parameters:
isSubscribedToEmails - whether or not the user should receive the campaign emails.

setPhoneNumber

public boolean setPhoneNumber(java.lang.String phoneNumber)
Sets the phone number of the user. Used to collect information about the user. Provided phone numbers must pass phone number validation. The validation methods used is available in com.appboy.support.ValidationUtils.

Parameters:
phoneNumber - The phone number of the user
Returns:
a boolean indicating whether or not the phone number passed basic validation

setCustomUserAttribute

public boolean setCustomUserAttribute(java.lang.String key,
                                      boolean value)
Sets a boolean custom user attribute. This can be any key/value pair and is used to collect extra information about the user. The key parameter is limited to 255 characters in length and can only contain alphanumeric characters and underscores. Keys which are too long will be truncated.

Parameters:
key - The identifier of the custom attribute
value - The boolean value of the custom attribute
Returns:
whether or not the custom user attribute was set correctly

setCustomUserAttribute

public boolean setCustomUserAttribute(java.lang.String key,
                                      java.lang.String value)
Sets a String custom user attribute. This can be any key/value pair and is used to collect extra information about the user. The key and value parameters are limited to 255 characters in length. The key parameter can only contain alphanumeric characters and underscores. Keys and values which are too long will be truncated.

Parameters:
key - The identifier of the custom attribute
value - The String value of the custom attribute
Returns:
whether or not the custom user attribute was set correctly

Parameters:

Returns:
whether or not the custom user attribute was set correctly

                                                        long secondsFromEpoch)
Sets a custom attribute to the given number of seconds elapsed since the epoch. The key parameter is limited to 255 characters in length and can only contain alphanumeric characters and underscores. Keys which are too long will be truncated.

setFacebookData

public boolean setFacebookData(FacebookUser facebookUserData)
Sets the Facebook profile data for this user. Multiple calls to this will result in a merged set of Facebook data where the most recent non-null, non-empty value for each field is persisted. Lists of Likes are not merged, the most recent list provided is used.

setTwitterData

public boolean setTwitterData(TwitterUser twitterUserData)
Sets the Twitter data for this user. Multiple calls to this will result in a merged set of Twitter data where the most recent non-null, non-empty value for each field is persisted.

getUserId

public java.lang.String getUserId()
Returns the currently tracked user id.
